content:
whldorsey1 said
I need to keep the emails that successfully made it into Tbird folders BUT avoid Tbird from ever trying to connect with it ever again (it hangs the whole app).

No can do. The bug requesting the enhancement is about as old as the application if I recall correctly. Well this one the 13 years old https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=689067

POP accounts are not linked to the account on the server post download, so for them you just remove the account. Once you move all the mail to local folders though as removing the account will obviously remove the account from the folder pane, so the mail needs somewhere else to live.

content:
Supporto in senso classico direi di no. Questo è solo un forum per gli utenti. E Thunderbird è un software gratuito, non ci sono risorse per pagare un team di supporto tecnico.

Quanto al tuo problema, se il server SMTP non risponde fino a far scadere la connessione, devi rivolgerti a chi fornisce il server stesso (di solito lo stesso che fornisce la casella di posta). Thunderbird ti sta solo mostrando un messaggio diagnostico del perché non riesce ad accedere al server. Questo beninteso nell'ipotesi che il server sia stata configurato correttamente in Thunderbird ovviamente.
creator: @next

content:
It is your Anti-Virus program. But it has nothing to do with virus. We have seen a few of these cases recently. Sounds like Anti-Virus got updated and now fails to recognises something it has been perfectly ok with previously. Most of them use self signed certificates and those cause issues with not being recognized.

If clicking on 'Bekraeft sikkerhedsundtagelse' (Confirm Security Exception') does not fix then... I would suggest you uninstall Anti-Virus Test sending to see if all is ok. If all works then you know it's the Anti-Virus Program. Then reinstall the Anti- Virus program and hopefully it will be able to read data correctly.

But please tell me...What Anti-Virus program are you using? Is it Norton ?

Second error says this in English: - using google translate Sending the message failed. Could not communicate securely with peer: the requested domain name does not match the server's certificate. Problems with the co-configuration need to be resolved

content:
Unfortunately, Anti-Virus programs are not useful when it comes to email. If Anti-virus is allowed to scan etc anything in your profile folders it has a problem because it does not undrestand how emails are stored.

Emails are downloaded to Inbox and stored in a single mbox text file called 'Inbox' (no extension). Each email is written to that file, one after the other as they are downloaded. So, one single text file document may contain a lot of emails. Anti-Virus does not know this. If it finds one email has an attachment it does not like, then if you have the setting to auto fix or you allow the fix then it's likely the entire file will get 'fixed' and this will result in email loss.

This is one of the reasons why you should create several Folders in Thunderbird to organise and store emails, so they are not all in one file. I would also advise that you do not allow any Anti-Virus or malware product access to your profile name folders OR if you do, then never allow/permit a fix, just make a note of where the problem is located. Please note: sometimes the bad file was already deleted, but not completely removed from profile - if you compact all folders then that will clean up and remove hidden marked as deleted old mail. Sometimes this in itself sotrs out the problem. Otherwise, if you know which file had problem, you can create a folder on desktop and then export copies of all emails in say the Inbox to that new folder on desktop as .eml files. Then run scan of that desktop folder. If it locates a bad email, then you know which one to delete in the Inbox in Thunderbird. Finally, delete the fodler on desktop and empty the computer recycle bin. A Bit long winded but you find the issue and don't lose emails.

However...you need to try and restore emails...I'll post in a another email/comment.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re : I have got an system backup of the October 24, 2024

But did that backup actually backup your Thunderbird Profile ? Can we first fully establish you have a backup of the profile.

If you are using Windows OS and you have your Thunderbird profiles in the default location then you are looking for this in the backup:

  • C://Users/<username>/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird

That 'Thunderbird' folder should contain the following:

  • C://Users/<username>/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles/<profile name>/Mail/<pop mail account name>

re :two e-mail addresses with this problem and five e-mail addresses without any problems In the 'Mail' folder, it should contain all your pop mail accounts and also 'Local Folders'.

Please confirm that you do have this backup and you can see various pop mail accounts in the Mail folder.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste di supporto:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)

content:
• Come hai eliminato l'account?
  • Hai eliminato anche il server SMTP? (Tasto menu > Impostazioni account> Server in uscita SMTP)
  • Usavi anche le funzioni Calendario di Gmail? Se si, hai eliminato il relativo account?
  • Similmente usavi anche la chat di Gmail?

Se invece vuoi ripartire da zero, la semplice disinstallazione non basta. Puoi fare due cose: - Disinstallare e poi cancellare la cartella del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_come-trovare-il-proprio-profilo Quindi reinstallare Thunderbird - Creare un nuovo profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/utilizzare-piu-profili che andrà ad affiancare quello esistente. In questo modo puoi ripartire da zero e rimuovere il vecchio profilo solo quando sei certo che quello nuovo funziona correttamente.
creator: @next

content: Ho eliminato l'account dalle impostazioni dell'app ("elimina account"). L'unico server SMTP che ho nell'app è quello dell'account che continuo a usare. Usavo anche le funzionalità di Google Calendar, non pensavo che si trattasse di un account diverso da quello di posta. Non so se riesco a raggiungerlo, poiché ci arrivavo solo tramite l'account email. Non vorrei ripartire da zero, perché l'ho già fatto più volte; se esistesse un'altra via, sarei sollevato. Se non vi fosse altra soluzione, proverei a rimuovere la cartella del profilo. Grazie.
creator: carlo.avossa

content: Dovresti avere un'icona nella finestra principale di Thunderbird per aprire il calendario. Una volta aperto guarda se tra i calendari c'è ancora quello legato alla casella Gmail che non usi più. Nel caso lo elimini.
creator: @next

content: C'era, effettivamente, la sottoscrizione al calendario della casella Gmail che non suo più, e l'ho eliminata. Purtroppo però il problema persiste. Ancora grazie per il tuo tempo.
creator: carlo.avossa

content:
Se la finestra continua a comparire c'è qualcosa legata a Google/Gmail che non è stata eliminata. Guarda anche tra le estensioni.

Dopodiché se non se ne viene a capo fai prima a ripartire da zero.
creator: @next

content:
Thunderbird does not have a scam folder, it has a junk/spam folder the name being dependent of the server the account is attached to.

Certain antivirus products have traditionally installed components into Thunderbird without asking. Those components usually go belly up what a new version is installed, so could it be your antivirus that is the problem here.
creator: MattAuSupport
